hedline.hl1: 1 Dead, 4 Hurt As Collision Throws Car Into a Crowd

abstract.p: Woman is killed and four other pedestrians injured when car is hit by another car and jumps sidewalk of busy street in Brownsville section of Brooklyn, plowing into crowd (S)

block.p: A 20-year-old woman was killed and four other pedestrians were injured when a car was hit by another car and jumped the sidewalk of a busy street in Brooklyn yesterday, plowing into a crowd, the police said.
The accident, on Atlantic Avenue near Thomas S. Boyland Street in the Brownsville section, occurred around 5:30 p.m. as commuters emerging from the subway waited to cross the street, witnesses said.

A 20-year-old woman was killed and four other pedestrians were injured when a car was hit by another car and jumped the sidewalk of a busy street in Brooklyn yesterday, plowing into a crowd, the police said.
The accident, on Atlantic Avenue near Thomas S. Boyland Street in the Brownsville section, occurred around 5:30 p.m. as commuters emerging from the subway waited to cross the street, witnesses said.
''It was just awful,'' said Sandra Dyer, who lives nearby and heard the collision.
Details of how the accident happened were slow to emerge and no charges were immediately filed against the drivers, said Sgt. Elias Nikas, a police spokesman.

The woman was dead on arrival at Brookdale Hospital Medical Center and a 20-year-old man was in critical condition last night. The other victims were another 20-year-old woman, who was at Brookdale, and a 24-year-old woman and a man, both of whom were being treated at Kings County Hospital, the police said.
Ms. Dyer said that the intersection, like many along wide, crowded Atlantic Avenue, was dangerous. Last week, Ms. Dyer said, she saw an elderly woman hit by a car while trying to cross Boyland.

The local City Council member, Tracy Boyland, said that after last week's accident, she asked the City Department of Transportation to add a left-turn arrow to the traffic light on Atlantic Avenue for eastbound cars turning onto Boyland. The project is proceeding, she said.
